p: A total of 36 quinoa samples comprised of three varieties ( Table 1), two harvest time-points, and three biological replicates were either inoculated with CMV or inoculation buffer. By 4 days after inoculation with CMV, chlorotic local lesions developed across all replicates of ‘QQ74’ and ‘Jessie’, whereas all replicates of the bitter variety ‘Red Head’ had local systemic chlorosis that was not spread throughout the plant ( Fig 1A, S2 Fig). Infection was confirmed in vivo by immunoassay and in silico, with all CMV genomic RNAs detected in RNASeq and small RNASeq datasets ( Fig 1B). Control samples that underwent mock-inoculation did not have symptoms or signs of infection.
